items.notes: Rinse 2â€“4 times until water runs mostly clear to remove extra starch/dust and reduce gumminess.

steps.step: Rinse red lentils (Wash!) 2â€“4 times until the water runs mostly clear. This removes extra starch/dust/bitterness and helps the curry stay creamy instead of gummy.
(Context rule) Whole brown/green lentils only need one quick rinse; canned lentils just drain (optional light rinse if salty).

steps.title: SautÃ© aromatics
steps.step: Heat oil in a large pot. Add onion, leeks, garlic, and ginger. Cook until soft and fragrant (6â€“8 minutes).

steps.title: Add spices
steps.step: Stir in curry powder, turmeric, cumin, paprika, and coriander (if using). Toast 1 minute until the aroma blooms.

steps.title: Add lentils + hard vegetables
steps.step: Add red lentils (Wash!), carrots, potatoes, sweet potato, and cabbage. Stir to coat in spices.

steps.title: Add coconut milk + broth
steps.step: Pour in coconut milk and 3â€“4 cups vegetable broth. Stir well and bring to a gentle simmer.

steps.title: Add soft vegetables
steps.step: After 10 minutes, add zucchini, broccoli, cauliflower, mushrooms, and tomatoes. Simmer until everything is soft but not mushy (12â€“15 minutes more).

steps.title: Finish
steps.step: Turn off heat and add spinach (it will wilt), soy sauce, lemon/lime juice, and honey/maple (optional). Taste and adjust salt (or add a little more curry powder if needed).

steps.title: Serve
steps.step: Top with chopped parsley or cilantro, extra lime, and an optional drizzle of coconut milk. Serve with rice, flatbread, quinoa, or enjoy as-is.
